3: Commandant, I have found a suitable school for Nanami with Celica's help. What say we send her over?
It's not like we have other jobs on our hands at the moment.
It's just going to school, nothing special.
Hm, Nanami doesn't want to leave Commandant.
Huh?
You see, when the Earth is reclaimed, everyone will be free! It won't be too late for my research!
The war's not looking good for us though. And before that time comes, can you promise that you'll never cause trouble again like last time out of selfishness?
Nanami's not selfish... It's just the time limit of the mission...
Time limit?
I don't know when that limit is, but isn't that all the more reason for you to finish your research as soon as possible?
But... but Nanami doesn't want to leave Commandant!

2: I don't want Nanami to leave either!

3: You two... Why do I feel like the villain...
Truth be told, I'm not interested in Nanami's mission at all, I just want her to stop making a mess of the base.
Can you promise to not destroy anything out of boredom from now on?
Nope!

4: I think you should say 'yes' here.

3: But Nanami will try her best starting from today.
Whether it's battles, daily tasks, or other missions, Nanami will take care of them all before the time limit!
In return, please become Nanami's finest research subject, Commandant.
Humans live in groups, and there are bound to be excellent individuals in a group.
And that individual is the most important research subject! At least that's what Nanami thinks.
What Nanami means to say is, please become the most outstanding human, Commandant!
Hehe! That's right!
Because you're the only one qualified to be my research subject and my commandant!
And the book did say that... Only an outing between two individuals who like each other can be called... a date. ANYONE—ELSE—WON'T—DO.
